page.title: 12HEALTH
page.content: {Health}Services in Biggar are reasonable for a small centre of population.There is a small {Cottage {Hospital} built about the turn of the century,which deals with fairly minor injuries,more serious ones are either sent to Edinburgh or Law Hospital. Next to the Hospital there is a { {Health Centre}. The institution of a { {Health Centre }is fairly recent and falls into line with developments elsewhere.The general health care needs are provided by two pharmacies,the sort of country practise that could be affected by new Government proposals on pharmacies.Outside Biggar there is a residential place for the Elderly called {Cornhill},which is run by the Region.
